newsitem.title: UK: Thames chief given 64 pct pay rise-paper.
newsitem.headline: Thames chief given 64 pct pay rise-paper.

text.p: Thames Water Plc chairman Robert Clarke received a 64 percent pay rise last year, bringing his remuneration package up to almost 100,000 stg, the Independent said on Friday.
The paper said the company's annual report and accounts also showed that Bill Alexander, Thames' managing director, was given a 40 percent pay raise.
It said the report showed that the basis salary of Clarke rose by 90,000 stg to 233,600 in the year ended March 1997. With other benefits included, his total pay rose by 96,000 stg to 247,000.
Alexander's pay increased to 226,000 stg from 161,000 stg, including a 33,000 stg bonus. --London Newsroom +44 171 542 5106
